column4: Tesla delays  tax credit concerns spur sales of Chevy Bolts
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Feb 16 Some potential buyers of Tesla's long-delayed Model 3 sedan are concerned that they will miss out on big federal tax breaks and are looking for alternatives  including General Motors Co's Chevrolet Bolt  according to postings by would-be Tesla buyers on websites and interviews with GM dealers.

column4: BRIEF-Intel Announces David Pottruck To Retire From Board Of Directors
column5: * INTEL ANNOUNCES DAVID POTTRUCK TO RETIRE FROM BOARD OF DIRECTORS

column4: Intel hit with 32 lawsuits over security flaws
column5: Intel Corp said on Friday shareholders and customers had filed 32 class action lawsuits against the company in connection with recently-disclosed security flaws in its microchips.

column4: Intel says 32 lawsuits filed against company over security flaws
column5: Feb 16 Intel Corp said on Friday 32 class action lawsuits had been filed against the company in connection with the recently disclosed security flaws in its chips.

column4: BRIEF-Intel Says 32 Lawsuits Filed Against Co Related To Chip Flaws

column4: Qualcomm says open to more deal talks with Broadcom following meeting
column5: Qualcomm Inc  on Friday called a meeting with Broadcom Ltd  to discuss the latter's $121 billion bid constructive and opened the door to more talks  but continued to reject the proposed deal between the semiconductor companies.

column4: UPDATE 2-Qualcomm says open to more deal talks with Broadcom following meeting
column5: Feb 16 Qualcomm Inc on Friday called a meeting with Broadcom Ltd to discuss the latter's $121 billion bid constructive and opened the door to more talks  but continued to reject the proposed deal between the semiconductor companies.

column4: BRIEF-Qualcomm Says Open To Discussions With Broadcom For Proposal That Reflects "True Value" Of Co's Shares
column5: * QUALCOMM INC - BOARD FOUND MEETING WITH BROADCOM "TO BE CONSTRUCTIVE"

column4: Qualcomm says open to talks with Broadcom for better offer
column5: Feb 16 Qualcomm Inc is open to discussing a buyout offer from Broadcom Ltd that "reflects the true value" of the chipmaker and better addresses concerns about regulatory hurdles to a deal  the company said on Friday.
